p: The intervention was well tolerated and adverse events were rare. Interestingly, the majority of participants did not feel hungry during fasting, as reported also in other studies [ 32]. Periodic fasting leads to significant weight loss, reduction of BMI and waist circumference. These observations are interpreted as positive effects, considering that at baseline the participants were pre-obese (BMI > 25 kg/m 2; overall and in the non-diabetic subgroup) or obese (BMI > 30 kg/m 2; in the T2DM subgroup). Both pre-obesity and obesity are regarded as general health risk factors [ 43].
